title: Sr. iOS Developer (Swift)
full_description: What you’ll be doing: This is a new position that is pioneering Tandem’s entry into the world of mobile health applications! As an experienced member of the Software Engineering team, you'll be responsible for designing and developing a first-generation mobile application that will allow our customers to view their pump data directly on their iPhone.In addition to meaningful, hands-on, technical work, you’ll also hone your leadership skills. You’ll lead projects and train and mentor junior team members all within a fun, casual environment that inspires collaboration and innovation.Mobile health applications are sweeping across the diabetes community and this is your opportunity to join the ground floor of Tandem’s mobile development strategy. Who we are:Here at Tandem, Diabetes is all we do, and we are dedicated to making the lives of people with diabetes better and better, through relentless innovation. Tandem has created the simple-to-use t:slim X2 Insulin Pump with Basal IQ technology. Designed, assembled and supported from our San Diego, CA headquarters, the t:slim X2 with Basal IQ is the only color, touch-screen insulin pump that is capable of remote feature updates, has a predictive low glucose suspend (PLGS) feature to help reduce the frequency and duration of low glucose events, and offers compatibility with continuous glucose monitoring.Read more about our company & culture here: https://www.tandemdiabetes.com/careers/life-at-tandem and see what our customers are saying here: #tsliminthewild What you need for this position: Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Computer Sciences or related field or equivalent combination of education and applicable job experience.Experience in Swift / Xcode requiredExperience in with a VCS, preferably Git8+ years’ experience in the field of mobile application for medical devices, web application software or in a related areaProficient with formal software test methodologiesProficient knowledge developing on the iOS and Android mobile platformsBasic knowledge of at least one embedded or cloud-based programming language, preferably C or C#Basic knowledge of JavaScript for using with automated testing.Proficient at using version control applications such as GIT and SVN.Skilled at translating high level requirements into software design and implementation. What's in it for you? We’ve got you covered. We offer a robust benefits package to support your health and your family. From medical, dental, and vision, to flexible spending accounts for both health and dependent care – Tandem’s got you covered!Stay well with us. Enjoy the outdoors during your workday by biking, running, or walking on one of our nearby trails. Or, break a quick sweat at our offsite gym, which boasts luxurious amenities including specialty fitness classes and state-of-the-art equipment.Invest in your career. Tandem offers all employees access to training and development programs and courses to help keep your career and skillset updated, not outdated.Live your life. Relax with 20 days of paid time off and celebrate 10 paid holidays in your first year. Save for your future with a company-sponsored 401(k) plan. Look forward to saving money on tickets to the San Diego Zoo, movies, restaurants, and so much more with our exclusive employee discount program. Tandem will also grant you stock options upon hire and the option to enroll in our lucrative Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP).Celebrate in Tandem. Join in monthly employee get-togethers, tacos for Cinco de Mayo, corned beef for St. Patrick’s Day, costume-contest for Halloween, and the annual JDRF walk.
